summary: This is an email chain regarding a quote request for a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, involving SigNet Technologies and a DOJ communication technician. The document appears to be routine procurement correspondence related to facility maintenance.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: SigNet Technologies sales representative providing quotes for camera system upgrades to the MCC New York.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: SigNet Technologies program manager handling FBOP contracts who forwarded the quote request to Steve Smith.

connections.description: Both work for SigNet Technologies, with Houston forwarding the quote request to Smith for handling.

events.title: Quote Request for MCC Camera Upgrade
events.description: A DOJ communication technician requests quotes for camera system upgrades at MCC New York, both partial and full upgrades, including costs for decoders and encoders.

events.title: Previous Quote Submission
events.description: Steve Smith indicates he had sent pricing information back in December 2016, which he states is still valid.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The document is procurement correspondence regarding camera system upgrades at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
SigNet Technologies is the vendor providing quotes for the security system upgrades to the DOJ facility.
The email chain shows routine government contracting procedures between a DOJ technician and a private technology vendor.
The document contains standard confidentiality disclaimers protecting SigNet Technologies' proprietary information.
This appears to be unrelated to Epstein case activities, focusing instead on facility maintenance at a federal correctional center.
